title: [PC] Rocket Power: Extreme Arcade Games
description:
Rocket Power: Extreme Arcade Games is a 2002 video game designed for the PC by THQ and Sapient Corporation. It uses Bink Video and Miles Sound System technology. It is based on the Nickelodeon TV show Rocket Power. It consists of 4 mini-games, Hockey Shot (Otto), Rocket Pogo (Sam), Sandcastle Slam (Reggie) and Roller Rocketball (Twister). Each mini-game is hosted by a Rocket Power character. Roller Rocketball, however, must be unlocked by playing games. It was featured in a double-pack with Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius.

The following are the minimum system requirements for "Rocket Power Extreme Arcade Games".

--100% Microsoft Windows compatible computer system
--233 MHz Pentium II processor (300MHz or above recommended)
--32 MB of RAM (64MB or above recommended)
--4x CD-ROM
--2MB (DirectX 8 compatible) Video Card (8MB or above recommended)
--DirectX 8 compatible sound card
--Approximately 150 MB of available uncompressed hard drive space

Note: As there is no no-CD .EXE file, the .ISO file will have to be mounted for the game to play, or else you'll see a window that says "Please click OK, insert 'Rocket Power Extreme Arcade Games' CD, then restart the game."
